citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 10:30 am on June
20, 2025. Upon arrival at facility the inspector attempted to contact the licensee by phone and left a message. The
inspector knocked on the door of the residence and honked the vehicle horn but there was no response. After 30 minutes
the inspector called the licensee again and left another message. The inspector stopped at the facility retail store about
1/4 mile down the road and an employee said the licensee had gone into town, so the inspector left the facility. At 11:08
the licensee called and left a message on the inspector's phone saying he was out making deliveries and would not be
around. Failure to provide access to the facility, animals, and records for inspection is a serious violation of the AWA and
regulations. Failure to comply may result in enforcement action.
End Section

narrative:
2.126(b) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 10:30 am on June 
20, 2025. Upon arrival at facility the inspector attempted to contact the licensee by phone and left a message. The 
inspector knocked on the door of the residence and honked the vehicle horn but there was no response. After 30 minutes 
the inspector called the licensee again and left another message. The inspector stopped at the facility retail store about 
1/4 mile down the road and an employee said the licensee had gone into town, so the inspector left the facility. At 11:08 
the licensee called and left a message on the inspector's phone saying he was out making deliveries and would not be 
around. Failure to provide access to the facility, animals, and records for inspection is a serious violation of the AWA and 
regulations. Failure to comply may result in enforcement action. 
 
 
End Section
